data.title: Multiple yield()s cut off code
data.body:
After a certain number of yields (which seems to be inconsistent, can be 2 or more that triggers the end in my tests), the remaining code in the coroutine is not run!

This script is run in a completely empty project (attached to the root node):

``` gdscript
func coroutine():
    print("2-1")
    yield()
    print("2-2")
    yield()
    print("2-3")
    yield()
    print("2-4")

func _ready():
    print("Starting")
    var co = coroutine()
    while co.is_valid():
        co.resume()
    print("Complete")
```

The output is:

```
Starting
2-1
2-2
Complete
```

data.title: Implement yield_from()
data.body:
Newer versions of Python implement yield_from(), which makes nesting co-routines easier.

You can mimic it in a coroutine with:

``` gdscript
    func coroutine1():
        # do something
        yield()

     func coroutine2():
         # Do stuff with yields

         var sub_coroutine = coroutine1()
         while sub_coroutine.is_valid():
             sub_coroutine.resume()
             yield()

         # do more stuff with yielding
```

But with yield_from():

``` gdscript
     func coroutine2():
         # Do stuff
         yield_from(coroutine1())
         # do more stuff
```

data.title: 3D particles are animated twice faster if material is set to pre-pass alpha
data.body:
Hi,

Like the title says, 3D particles are animated twice faster if the Depth Draw parameter of the material is set to Pre-Pass Alpha.

data.title: Add the OS’s “favourite” paths to the editor’s open and save window
data.body: Paths like Desktop, user’s documents, user’s home directory, etc.

data.title: Add more primitives to the editor for rapid prototyping
data.body:
When it comes to rapid prototyping, rather than creating a new scene in the 3d or 2d modelling tool of choice, and then importing that scene to Godot, it would be great if one could just add primitives like spheres, cylinders, circles, etc. to the scene directly from the Godot editor.

Also exporting the scene from Godot as COLLADA and maybe SVG for 2d scenes, would make easier to move from prototyping to fleshing out the scene with textures and more detailed geometry.

data.title: Make View > Settings a non check item
script editor : parenthesis matching get confused with strings containing parenthesis
data.body:
hi,

this is just a minor bug ...

for instance :

```
print( ")" )
```

the script editor will match the `print`'s opening parenthesis with the closing parenthesis contained into the string, and will put the actual `print`'s closing parenthesis in red.

this create no problem excepting some little confusion when writing long sentences like this :

```
var ptype = part.get_name().substr( 1, part.get_name().find(")") - 1 )
```

data.title: Corrected behaviour of File.READ_WRITE mode (fixes #378)
FuncRef.call_func mis-documented
data.body:
FuncRef.call_func() is incorrectly called FuncRef.exec() in the wiki!

https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/gdscript#function-references

data.title: EditorScenePostImport : children nodes added by the script are ignored
data.body:
Hi,

I don't know if it is a bug or a missing feature, but it would be cool if `EditorScenePostImport` allowed to insert new children nodes into the scene.

I wanted to create some children nodes from inside the EditorScenePostImport script when importing a collada scene.

When I add AnimationPlayer nodes, or a simple TestCube into the scene, it will not appear into the final scene-tree displayed into the editor.

However if I do a `parent.print_tree()` from inside the post-import script, it will diplay the new child into its tree ... so it's like if new children were removed by a POST-post-import filter .... 

On the other hand, `node.create_convex_collision()` works fine and adds successfully children nodes to MeshInstances nodes.

Is it bug ? Is it related to the "update logic strategies" system which prevent adding new nodes ? is it me ?

here are minimal test-case files : https://github.com/UsernameIsAReservedWord/bug-EditorScenePostImport

data.title: Fixed compilation error on OSX
data.body: When I tried to compile the editor on OSX, it failed on the modified line. I believe it's working now.

data.title: Meta+A in a text field of the property inspector opens the "Create New Node" menu
data.body:
When I edit a button caption or a label text with the property inspector and I hit Meta+A (here on OS X it is CMD+A), the "Create New Node" menu pops up.
What I expected: select all text in the field I currently edit.

data.title: Fix a shadow declaration
data.body: This was causing the build to fail for `platform=X11`.

data.title: Invalid type in built-in function 'dict2inst' warning
data.body:
Hi, I develop a vertical-scrolling game. The obstacles such as enemies, rocks, etc., are generated programatically by instantiating scenes: 
var obs = load(obstacle_list[randrange(0,10)] + ".scn").instance()
add_child(obs)
When I tested on my PC (Ubuntu 14.04) everything was OK. Obstacles are generated smoothly. But I got this error message when I run on android (from adb logcat): 
"Invalid type in built-in function 'dict2inst'. Cannot convert argument 1 from String to Dictionary."
The game was running, but the obstacles are not generated. No instantiated scene.

data.title: Tile Rotation
data.body:
Adds quarter rotations for tiles to TileMaps by composing flips with new transpose transform.
Adds extra tool button for transpose as well as dedicated buttons for each quarter rotation.

As this touches a lot of files, I ask others do some testing before it's merged to make sure I haven't broken anything.

(Duplicate of #1330. Just moving this out of my master branch.)

data.title: Implement rasterizer billboard_y property.
data.body:
Implement rasterizer billboard_y property.
Based on NeHE tutorial (http://nehe.gamedev.net/article/billboarding_how_to/18011/).
3D isn't really my thing, but it looks to work fine in my tests.
Should fix #1366.

data.title: Better 2D Snapping
data.body:
Consolidated duplicate snapping functions into CanvasItemEditor.
Allow non-square grids.
Add grid origin offsets.
Allow separate toggling of grid display.
Add rotation snapping.
Add offset snapping.

data.title: Sprite3D and MeshInstance -> BillboardY property doesn't work
data.body:
Hello together,

in Godot 1.0 stable the BillboardY property from Sprite3D seems broken.

To test create a Sprite3D node, add a texture and activate the BillboardY property in the editor and it should nothing happens. The normal Billboard property works fine.

I use Godot 1.0 stable under Kubuntu 14.04.

data.title: [request] Key down/up event
data.body:
It is usefull to make action game or others. 
Now I have to check the key state of the previous frame to make sure that.But it does not work, when someone pressed fast enough.

Edit:

After that, I look into the cpp code. I see I can override MainLoop to get the InputEvent. But I have no idea about how to do that.

data.title: 2d Circular shape bounce not as expected
data.body:
2d circular shape on hitting boundaries with rectangular shape does not work as expected. The ball spins and comes to halt, or at times changes direction randomly,

It would also help if the degrees of freedom can be limited or constrained, like remove angular constraints from a body

![boundary](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6497623/6188557/389a3582-b3b8-11e4-9430-0b046c620f60.png)

data.title: Added body mode property for TileMap as kinematic body
data.body:
Added body mode property to TileMap to select between static and kinematic physics bodies. Kinematic allow use of TileMaps for moving platforms for example.
Updated 2D Platformer demo to use kinematic TileMaps for moving platforms, in doing so discovered that the tileset_edit.xml scene was messed up and not converting properly, so fixed that too.
And in order to fix the tileset without too much pain I needed to activate snapping for collision polygon vertices.

Rigid bodies for TileMaps would be cool to add too but I'm not sure how to go about making the separate bodies for each quadrant act as one object.

data.title: uniforms for shared 2d shaders overwriting eachother
data.body:
When two things (sprites, in my example) share a shader, they both have their own fields for setting uniforms for the shader.  These values are retained in the GUI, but only one of the values is actually used when rendering both sprites.

Example project.  Try changing the alpha uniform for each sprite:
https://copy.com/07dR7cJ6NmaZfRwb

data.body:
The last commit b3a6cc097d5bc60ee6e7ba30b177bed3a8aadc71 compiles properly on Xubuntu 14.10 64 but the binary crashes immediately with the following error:

> ERROR: cleanup: ObjectDB Instances still exist!
>    At: core/object.cpp:1715.

data.title: fix get_joy_name() on windows
data.body:
The szPname field in joycaps contains "Microsoft PC-joystick driver" for
almost all devices. working around this by retrieving joystick name from
registry

data.title: arrows + space-bar not work perfectly
[feature request] add mouse wheel up/down to button_mask
data.body:
Hi,

Given that the mouse wheel is treated as `BUTTON_WHEEL_UP` and `BUTTON_WHEEL_DOWN`, it would be cool if they were also added to the `mouse_button_mask`.

This way, it would be possible to detect mouse wheel actions using `Input.is_mouse_button_pressed(BUTTON_WHEEL_UP/DOWN)`.
